questions.question_text:
Universal Containers’ Support team is growing globally, and the manager has inquired about implementing Omni-Channel. The team supports multiple products that require complex expertise across multiple languages.

Which routing option should the administrator recommend to ensure the right cases get to the correct agents for resolution?

comments.content:
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.set_up_omni_channel_routing.htm&type=5
- enable skill-based and direct to agent routing

discussion.content: I think it should be A

Selected Answer: A
A is the most suited answer - as explained in this article - https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.omnichannel_how_skills_based_routing_works.htm&type=5

A
Based on the requirement, the administrator should recommend implementing Skills-Based Routing. This would allow the Support team to route cases based on specific skills or expertise required for each case. The administrator can define skills and assign them to agents, and when a new case is created, Omni-Channel automatically routes it to the most qualified and available agent based on the defined skills.

Additionally, the Translation Workbench is used for translating the user interface of the Salesforce org, and it is not related to Omni-Channel routing.

Queue-Based Routing and Case Assignment Rules are other routing options available in Salesforce, but they do not provide the level of complexity and flexibility required for routing cases based on specific skills or expertise.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is setting up Salesforce Knowledge and wants to implement an easy way for agents to create new articles from multiple objects.

Which two options could the administrator do to meet this requirement? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Use the Service Setup Assistant to Configure Knowledge.
choices.A: Add the New Article global action to required page layouts.
choices.C: Deploy a screen-based flow from the home page.
choices.B: Create a custom quick action for each object.

discussion.content:
A. Add the New Article global action to required page layouts.
B. Create a custom quick action for each object.

To enable agents to create new articles from multiple objects in Salesforce Knowledge, an administrator can do the following:

A. Add the New Article global action to required page layouts: This allows users to create new articles directly from the page layout of an object record. When a user clicks the New Article button, they are taken to the article creation page, where they can select the article type and enter the article details.

B. Create a custom quick action for each object: This allows users to create new articles directly from the related list of an object record. When a user clicks the Create Article button, they are taken to the article creation page, where they can select the article type and enter the article details.

choices.B: Change the access levels in the marketing user standard profile to read, create and edit for the product object
choices.C: Create a permission set with read and write access for the product object and assign it to the marketing users
choices.D: Create a permission set with read, create and edit access for the product object and assign it to the marketing users
choices.A: Create a new profile for the marketing users and change the access levels to read, create and edit for the product object

questions.question_text:
A team is assigned to standardize processes across internal teams for Salesforce Knowledge. The team finds it difficult to effectively group the articles due to the slightly different verbiage used by each of the Support teams, which makes searching and search results inconsistent.

Which two customizations should an administrator use to allow for a better experience when searching? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Highlight relevant article text within search results.
choices.B: Create search activity report with promoted search terms.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A - Use the record editability properties to determine who can edit records that are locked in this approval process. https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.approvals_create_recordeditability.htm&type=5

A
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.approvals_create_recordeditability.htm&type=5

A. Record Editability Properties could prevent the record from being editable by the manager.

Record Editability Properties control whether a record can be edited, deleted, or cloned based on certain criteria, such as the record's status, user's role, or profile. In this case, it is possible that the record editability properties have been configured to prevent edits once the record has been submitted for approval.

Therefore, if the manager is unable to edit the record after it has been submitted for approval, the record editability properties should be checked to ensure that they allow for editing of records in the appropriate status.
